sentence.Network_en: The speaker suddenly made a recantation and left us all rather confused.
sentence.Network_cn: 演讲人突然改变论调，把我们都搞糊涂了。

list.abs: Unless you recant your confession , you will be punished severely ., 除非你收回你的供词 , 你将严厉惩罚.
because if you have no beliefs to recant , then what ? .你没有信仰可以放弃，那么？
What if I had to get you recant ?, 如果我不得不让你放弃信仰?
unless you recant your confession , you will be punished severely .除非你收回你的供词，你将严厉惩罚。
thousands of members were forced to recant or suffer torture and death in labour camps .上千名会员被迫放弃信仰，或在劳改营中遭受酷刑和死去。

means.word_mean: 1. a disavowal or taking back of a previous assertion

auth_sentence.content: He dramatically stuck his right hand, with which he had signed his recantation, into the fire first.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He dramatically stuck his right hand, with which he had signed his recantation, into the fire first.

sentences.en: We should not insult them, take away their personal effects or try to exact recantations from them, but without exception should treat them sincerely and kindly.
sentences.cn: 不加侮辱，不搜财物，不要自首，一律以诚恳和气的态度对待之。
